page.title: 01Hoy
page.content: This area is very mountainous, rising to 280 m. A steep sided u-shaped valley,Rackwick Valley has been cut in the northwest of the area. The ground is all Moorland with Heather and Peat bogs. A lot of this ws destroyed by fire in Rackwick valley in 1984, but growth has quickly started again. The hill tops suffer from frost damage,so there is little vegetation, just bare shattered rock on the summits. The Dwarfie Stone in Rackwich valley is the only example in Britain of a rock cut tomb, dated 3000 bc. It was the residence of Trolld, a dwarf famed in Norse legend. This monument has an inscription carved, in persian in 1850 by Major William Mouncey. He was an eccentric who had been a spy in Afganistan and Persia. He wore Persian costume and spent several nights inside the stone.
